articles.title: Floral Basket Laid before Portraits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Basket Laid before Portraits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- Chikez Diemu, general secretary of the National Executive Committee of the People's Party for Rehabilitation of Democratic Congo and Democracy, visited the DPRK embassy in the country, placed a floral basket before the portraits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them on October 10 on the occasion of the 6th anniversary of Kim Jong Il's election as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 58th anniversary of the WPK.
 Meanwhile, the Movement of the Libyan Revolution Committee sent a large bouquet in the name of the movement together with a congratulatory message to the DPRK embassy on Oct. 9.

articles.title: Anniversary of DPRK Red Cross Society Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of DPRK Red Cross Society Marked 
    Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- A meeting took place in Pyongyang yesterday on the occasion of the founding anniversary of the DPRK Red Cross Society.
 The participants conversed with each other about the Red Cross activities, deepening their friendly feelings.    
 An art performance was given by young members of the Red Cross Society.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomats Visit Kaechon-Lake Thaesong Waterway
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Visit Kaechon-Lake Thaesong Waterway 
    Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- The Economic and Commercial Councilors' Corps here visited the Kaechon-Lake Thaesong Waterway yesterday on the occasion of the 58th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 77th anniversary of the Down-with-Imperialism Union.
 The guests were briefed on the fact that servicepersons of the People's Army and builders built the waterway as a great monumental edifice in the Songun era, overcoming obstacles and difficulties in the revolutionary soldier spirit and the revolutionary spirit of fortitude under the adverse conditions where they were hard pressed for everything.    
 They looked round the Taegak Youth Dam and other structures and the waterway extending more than 150 km.

KCNA on U.S. Talk about "Peaceful Solution to Nuclear Issue"
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Regional Office Director of WHO
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Regional Office Director of WHO
    Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a gift from the director of the South-East Asia Regional Office of the World Health Organization (WHO).
 It was conveyed to DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun by Director Uton Muchtar Rafei on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: 12th Inter-Korean Ministerial Talks Close
Messages Exchanged between Foreign Ministers of DPRK and Mongolia
articles.content:
Messages Exchanged between Foreign Ministers of DPRK and Mongolia
    Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- The foreign ministers of the DPRK and Mongolia exchanged messages of greetings on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the two countries.
 DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun in a message expressed the belief that the traditional friendly relations between the two countries based on the close relations established by President Kim Il Sung in his lifetime with the leaders of Mongolia would grow stronger in various fields in conformity with the desire and interests of the two peoples in the future, too.    
 Mongolian Foreign Minister Luvsangiin Erdenechuluun in a message noted with satisfaction that the traditional and friendly relations and cooperation between the two countries are positively developing in the spirit of the treaty of friendship and cooperation signed in 2002. He wished the DPRK people success in their work for the peaceful reunification of the country and its prosperity and development.

articles.title: South Side's Delegation Visits Various Places
Kim Yong Nam Meets Koreans in U.S.
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Koreans in U.S.
    Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today met and had a conversation with Son Won Thae, a Korean in the United States, and his party in an atmosphere overflowing with compatriotic feelings at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.

articles.title: South Side's Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
South Side's Delegation Leaves
    Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- The south side's delegation with Jong Se Hyon, minister of Unification, as chief delegate left here today after participating in the 12th North-South Ministerial Talks.
 It was seen off at the airport by delegates of the north side to the talks.

articles.title: Congratulations to Chinese Party and State Leaders
articles.content:
Congratulations to Chinese Party and State Leaders
    Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, together with Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, and Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, today sent a congratulatory message to Hu Jintao, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and president of the People's Republic of China, Wu Bangguo, chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress of the PRC, and Wen Jiabao, prime minister of the Chinese State Council, on the successful launch of the first manned spaceship in China .
 The message said that the launch of the manned spaceship in China is a significant event which demonstrated that its overall national power has further increased and its science and technology reached a high level.    
 It sincerely wished the Chinese people greater success in their future work to modernize the country and further develop the space science and technology under the leadership of the CPC with Hu Jintao as its general secretary.
